content.description: Trends right to join Procrastination Proclamation Anchors
content.location: Left Side Wall next climb left of and shares anchors with Procrastination Proclamation

climbs.name: Toilet to Tango
climbs.fa: Angel Mangual, Ben Smith and Dave Evans

content.description:
It starts with some face climbing that gets you to some great layback moves.  The crux is getting out of the layback into the face.  It will end after a roof with some cool moves.   

  This route routes has some face, layback and roof climbing. Great Route!
content.protection: 7 bolts with 2 bolt anchors with carabiners
content.location: Immediate right of Tequila Sunrise

content.description:
I do not know if this route has seen a first ascent but we named it Tequila Sunrise.  It has a lot of under cling and cool moves.  The crux will be before the end.   

  Where the under cling are located, the rock looks like a bunch of sea shells glued together.
content.protection: 7 bolt and 2 bolt anchors with carabiners
content.location: Right of Pss Pss

content.description: It was fun figuring out this route.   You will need to be ready to use your undercling technique on this.  The crux is from the second to the third bolt.  From here there are couple of moves to the roof towards the Turtle Head.
content.location: Immediate right  of Toilet to Tango

content.description: Fun climb & a good warm-up, but very bad bolting.  After the first 2 bolts you'll follow the holds, which stray about 2-3 meters left of the bolt line (i.e. pendulum fall), coming back just to clip the next 2 bolts, which are off-route. There's evidence of the bolt line being moved left (empty 3/8" hole), but certainly not enough. It isn't a big deal if this climb is within your ability, but do bear this in mind if 10+/11- is at your limit.
content.location: 7th route left of Robby the Robot

content.description: Fun, hard moves (i.e. the crux) get you to a no-hands rest.  Make sure you recover, because there's a redpoint crux waiting for you just before the anchor...
content.protection: Bolts, chain anchor. You may find it helpful to have double-length draws on the anchor for your redpoint attempt.
content.location: 5th route left of Robby the Robot

content.description:
This climb carries a ton of climbing in a short span.  It starts beneath a black water streak and veers left after the forth bolt.  It continues climbers right off the roof to the anchors.   

  The first crux is between the fourth and fifth bolt while coming out of the hole toward a ledge.  At this ledge try to get it back because the red point crux starts here until clipping the eight bolt over the roof.  The sixth bolt before the roof is a working bolt.  During the red-point attempt,  it is good just to skip it and save your energy (it makes for a fun and long whipper).  We extended the bolt on the lip of the roof and it was very useful.   

  Both cruxes and the movement through the roof makes this route a must do in the area.   It will take a lot of body tension and foot work.
content.protection: 8 Bolts and 2 Bolt Anchors with steel carabiner
content.location: Left Side Wall climb left of I am the Eggplant

content.description: Full-value route. Not too pumpy, fun moves all the way to the chains. Although probably not the best warm-up.
content.location: Left-side wall.  ~2 routes left of Johnny on the Spot.  Starts at a black streak that runs from a tree/shrub all the way to the ground.  This particular plant sits in a right-facing corner about 3/4 up the route.

content.description: Some long, powerful moves on mostly good holds on nice stone.
content.location: First route right of I am the Eggplant. Starts just left of a large ledge.

content.description: Recently reclaimed (winter 2020) from the original bad bolting, this climb is now more worth tying in for.If you can manage the steep start and low crux the climbing does ease as one climbs higher, but there are still some tricky moves that can steal your send.There are an abundance of cool grips on this climb with some of the better tufas at the Shallow End to be fondled on your way to the chains.
content.protection: 6 bolts, shares lower-off anchor with Johnny on the Spot
content.location: Just right of Johnny of the Spot.

content.description: Good face climbing
content.location: Left Side Wall next climb right of Morbius

content.description: Fun route with crux at the buldge and jugs to the top
content.location: Left Side Wall second to last climb

content.description: 2 cruxes: one early on, one to steal your redpoint near the end. Great movement, very fun route.  No super-long moves.
content.location: Immediately left of Robby the Robot.

climbs.name: MoonLight Pokey
climbs.fa: Angel Mangual, Ben Smith and Evangeline

content.description: Pokey is Grumpy's brother, but it was created under the moonlight. This is a short easy route with a face climb crux at the top.
content.protection: 6 bolts. It shares anchors with Grumpy Cats Revenge
content.location: Left of Grumpy Cats Revenge

content.description:
This one is an under appreciated and often overlooked climb that is well worth more traffic.   

     Begin with a novel heel hook and rock over move before you leisurely navigate juggy ledges below the large tufas and vertical face.  Once past the tufas and onto the face you must decipher the ever more cryptic and sapping moves on your way to the heartbreaker crux that guards the chains.  

     Hopefully this line will see more traffic.  It is well worth tying in for.
content.location: Currently the last climb before the Spine Cave sector.

content.description:
Every crag needs a hesitation blues. 

  A couple long moves and just enough pump factor to make it 12-.
content.location: Left Side Wall next climb left of Robby the Robot

content.description: A stick clip for the first bolt is highly recommended.  This route has some good sequences in the middle.  The crux is between the 3rd and 4th bolt.  On the 5 bolt, milk the rest because the ending is not a gimme.  This is a very good route!
content.protection: 6 bolts and bolted anchors no carabiners
content.location: Between Forbidden Planet and Circus Freak.

climbs.name: Grumpy Cat's Revenge
climbs.fa: Ben Smith, Angel M, Brett Thompson, Evangeline

content.description: This is a good moderate route at the Shallow End.  It has a slabby section between the 3rd and 4th bolt which is the crux.  You will pass a good layback and go up the roof.  The anchors are at a good ledge. Happy Birthday Evangeline!
content.location: Left of Bumblebee Party

content.description: This is a good short route.  The crux starts after the third bolt.  You will need to find the good rest or you will make this route harder that what it is :-).  There is another crux after the 4th bolt that is very techy.The ending is pretty mellow but not a gimme.
content.protection: 5 bolts and two anchors with carabiners
content.location: Right of Pss Pss and it goes right of the obvious black tufa.

content.description: Similar feel to Splitting Bamboo.  Bouldery crux down low, good rest, redpoint crux up high.
content.protection: Bolts, chain anchor. You may find it helpful to have double-length draws on the anchor for your redpoint attempt.
content.location: 4th route left of Robby the Robot

content.description: Great route! The first crux is at the beginning with a redpoint crux at the middle of the route.  It gradually get easier up to the anchors.
content.location: First route to the right of "101" and two routes left of Sun Salute

content.description: This route gradually gets harder.  After the last roof, it gets thin (the crux) going to the anchors. This route has a super fun roof with hidden holds.  It is a must do in the area.
content.location: Between Helium and Morbius.

climbs.name: Bumblebee Party
climbs.fa: Ben Smith, Brett Thompson, Angel M, Evangeline

content.description: I wish it just kept going but it is the Shallow End. The crux is between the 4th and the 5th bolt.  Pretty cool moves going through the roof.
content.location: Left of 101

content.description: It follows some ledges and low angle climb. It is the only moderate route below 5.9  worth getting on in this area. If you are with kids they seem to enjoy it a lot.
content.location: This route is the fourth route from left to right.  Left of Downward Dog.

content.description: This route looks more intimidating than what it is.  Once you start climbing it, you will find all the hidden holds and moves.  The crux is between the second and third draw.   This is a very good route and warm up for this section.
content.location: The route is right of Shit N Cactus

content.description: The Shallow End is comprised of many worthwhile routes varying in difficulty from 5.8 to 5.12c. Notably, the left end is the only place at The Dry where climbers will find a concentration of sub 5.10 climbing. The remainder of the routes are on stellar rock with many bouldery sequences. Most are well worth climbing despite their comparatively short length of 50-55 feet.
